ASCII is able to represent every character using a number between 32 and 127. Space is 32, the letter “A” is 65, etc. This could conveniently be stored in 7 bits
Unicode was a brave effort to create a single character set that included every reasonable writing system on the planet and some make-believe ones like Klingon, too.
In UTF-8, every code point from 0-127 is stored in a single byte.
It does not make sense to have a string without knowing what encoding it uses.
It’s harder to read code than to write it.
When you throw away code and start from scratch, you are throwing away all that knowledge. All those collected bug fixes. Years of programming work.
